course_title: Special Topics in African American Studies: Readings PopLiterature/Culture
class_notes:
(Same as ENG 212W 2)
(Course Topic: The Poet's Prose as Protest) This course explores a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, and social and literary texts in prose written by African American poets.
Required Textbooks:
Sister Outsider, Audre Lorde (recommended; excerpts provided in Canvas)
They Can't Kill Us Until They Kill Us, Hanif Abdurraqib
How the Word is Passed: A Reckoning with the History of Slavery Across America, Clint Smith
course_description: Wide range of topics pertinent to the African American experience.
sections: Class Nbr: 6055, Section #: 3, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: Y. Franklin, Status: Open
